question: What is the difference between label encoding and one-hot encoding?
section: Technical Interview: Model Training and Evaluation

question:
One-hot encoding is a technique where each category in a categorical variable is represented by a binary vector, with a 1 in the position of the category and 0s elsewhere. One-hot encoding is useful when there are many categories in a variable, while label encoding can be useful when the categories have a natural order or hierarchy.

Question 4: What are some potential pitfalls to avoid when doing feature engineering?
